Syllabus.title: Syllabus
Syllabus.description: Represents the syllabus document for a specific course or program.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Syllabus entity.

courseName.description: The name of the course or program the syllabus belongs to (e.g., 'Electronics and Telecommunication 2nd Year').

year.description: The academic year the syllabus is for (e.g., 2023).

major.description: The major that this syllabus falls under.

pdfStorageLocation.description: The location where the syllabus PDF is stored (e.g., a URL or file path).

uploadDate.description: The date and time the syllabus was uploaded.

Doubt.title: Doubt
Doubt.description: Represents a student's doubt or question regarding a specific topic.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Doubt entity.

studentId.description: The ID of the student who asked the doubt.

studentName.description: The name of the student who asked the doubt.

studentYear.description: The academic year of the student who asked the doubt.

major.description: The major of the student who asked the doubt.

description.description: The detailed description of the doubt.

timestamp.description: The date and time the doubt was submitted.

status.description: The current status of the doubt.

senior.description: The name of the senior who resolved the doubt.

solution.description: The solution provided by the senior.

syllabusId.description: The syllabus associated with this doubt.

History.title: History
History.description: Represents the history of user interactions and searches within the application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the History entity.

studentId.description: Reference to Student. (Relationship: Student 1:N History). The user who performed the action.

query.description: The search query or action performed by the user.

timestamp.description: The date and time the action was performed.

resultId.description: Reference to the entity that represents the result (e.g. id of Resource, Doubt, etc.).

Student.title: Student
Student.description: Represents a student using the application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Student entity.

major.description: The student's major or field of study.

expertise.description: Optional field for the student to list their areas of expertise.

LeaderboardEntry.title: LeaderboardEntry
LeaderboardEntry.description: Represents a single entry on the leaderboard for a senior.

id.description: Unique identifier for the entry, typically the senior's user ID.

points.description: The total points accumulated by the senior.

doubtsResolved.description: The number of doubts resolved by the senior.

params.name: userId

params.name: userId

params.name: historyId

params.name: doubtId

params.description: The unique ID of the senior.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to facilitate the PES Nexus application's core features. Syllabuses are in a top-level public collection. All user-specific data, including history, are stored in subcollections under a top-level `/users/{userId}` document. Doubts are in a top-level collection to allow seniors to query for questions. Update rules for doubts are now more specific, allowing changes only by the owner or a senior resolving it. A `/leaderboard` collection stores pre-calculated scores for performance. This model is secure, scalable, and simplifies security rules.
